labels.analysis: The MCP Server "Zonos TTS Integration" is focused on providing text-to-speech (TTS) capabilities, allowing users to convert text into speech with support for multiple emotions and languages. The primary functionality revolves around generating speech output from text input, which can be used in various applications such as accessibility tools, interactive applications, or voice-enabled interfaces.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Content Creation" is chosen because the server's core functionality is generating speech from text, which is a form of media generation. The secondary label "AI/ML Tools" is included because TTS typically relies on machine learning models. Since the predefined categories do not have a "Text-to-Speech" category, no custom label is needed as the existing labels sufficiently describe the functionality.

server_info_crawled.name: Zonos TTS Integration
server_info_crawled.author: @PhialsBasement/zonos-tts-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable text-to-speech capabilities through Claude. Generate speech with support for multiple emotions and languages.
server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@PhialsBasement/zonos-tts-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
